snippet: Authoritarian rulers have long viewed pro-democracy groups financed by the United States with deep suspicion, but never has a government gone as far as Egypt’s.
abstract: Egypt confirms that it intends to try 19 Americans and more than two dozen other people on charges stemming from a criminal investigation of pro-democracy groups supported by the United States; all are members of four such nonprofit organizations that are based in Washington and that receive some United States government support; all the groups said they have tried to comply with Egyptian laws and be transparent about their activities.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and RON NIXON
byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Authoritarian rulers have long viewed pro-democracy groups financed by the United States with deep suspicion, but never has a government gone as far as Egypt’s.

headline.seo: In Egypt, a History of Distrust of U.S.-Aided Groups
headline.main: Charges Against U.S.-Aided Groups Come With History of Distrust in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Charges Against U.S.-Aided Groups Come With History of Distrust in Egypt

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
